title: Rare 50p coins featuring panto characters to enter circulation - worth £200 each
text:

Five brand new 50ps have been released to celebrate panto season in the UK - but finding one in your change could make you hundreds of pounds better off.

There's just one tiny issue - very few coins will be released to the general public, and none at all on the mainland.

The coins will only be released on the Channel Island of Guernsey - meaning it is going to be even trickier and more valuable to find one in your change.

Coins firm the Westminster Collection explained: "The coins have been authorised for release by Guernsey Treasury, the first ever festive coins to be issued by Guernsey.

"And each has been fully approved by Her Majesty the Queen."

Each of the coins depicts a different panto - with the five designs showing...

Aladdin

Cinderella

Snow White

Jack and the Beanstalk

Dick Whittington

As well as the coins entering circulation there is a commemorative set of all five coins in brilliant uncirculated condition as well as a colourised Silver Proof edition.

A spokesman for ChangeChecker said: "Guernsey has never released a Christmas coin before.

"This is bound to make these Christmas Panto 50ps particularly special for coin collectors.

"However it's fair to say that Christmas themed coins make an envious addition to anyone's collection, with the numerous festive 50ps from the Isle of Man proving to be incredibly popular.

"One of the most-loved Christmas themes to feature on a coin has got to bethe Snowman. In 2003, the first coin to feature the Snowman was issued by the Isle of Man and had atiny mintage of just 10,000.

"Although not many of these coins are available on the secondary market, if you did want to add one to your collection, you'd be looking at parting with a minimum of £200!"

The coins uncirculated brilliant and coloured versions are available to buy here
description: Pantomime characters Aladdin, Cinderella, Snow White, Jack and the Beanstalk and Dick Whittington will appear on the new coins this Christmas
